result.execSummary:
All charges against Shannon Darrell Coleman in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shannon Darrell Coleman is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon Darrell Coleman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Request for Early Release signed and filed.  Copy sent to State and Defendant
AFFIDAVIT AND ORDER FORPAYMENT OF ATTORNEY FEES AND COST, signed and filed. lms

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman not in court.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is deceased.  Court ordered case dismissed on prosecutors motion.

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman appears pro se via telephone with social worker.  Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is hospitalized at Dodge Correctional Facility for a terminal illness and not in good condition to go to trial pro se.  Court vacates the 2/29/2016 jury trial date and ordered case adjourned for a status date.  Defendant to submit a Modification for Bifurcated sentence.

The defendant no longer wishes to be pro se and request Stand-by Counsel be appointed to fully represent him.   Attorney Harris accepts the appointment to represent the defendant as counsel.  Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
AFFIDAVIT EXTRAORDINARY HEALTH CONDITION, received and filed.  lms

Attorney  pro se in court, defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman not in court, in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.    Attorney Thomas Harris in court as STAND-BY counsel. 

Defendant not produced due to medical issues.  Court orders case adjourned for Final Pretrial.  Parties had discussions over a Pro Se motion submitted.  State feels the motion is incorrectly labeled and per other request, the defendant should submit a Denny motion. State to submit a response to the defendant's request.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 6.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
MOTION TO COMPEL DISCOVERY AND INSPECTION.
per order dated November 5, 2015, Appeal 2015AP2099CRLV, the petition for leave to appeal is dismissed.

Standby counsel Thomas E. Harris in court, defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman not in court, in custody not produced.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for status conference.
Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference on 1/25/16 at 8:30 am in Branch 6.
Court ordered no contact with SLH.

Court ordered a signature bond in the amount of $1,000.00.  Court ordered defendant turned over to JusticePoint Pretrial Services upon release and GPS monitoring.  Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.  With regard to GPS monitoring, Court ordered absolutely no release from home except for the following: laundry (1x per week, 2 hours), grocery shopping (1x per week, 1 hour) and legal appointments.

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in court with attorney Thomas E Harris as standby counsel.  Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for jury trial.
Amended information received and filed changing conduct from sexual intercourse to sexual contact, charged statute remains the same.  Copy given to defendant who requested reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  State informs Court that they will proceed without victim cooperation.  Court is in jury trial on another matter and orders jury trial adjourned.  Because defendant's speedy trial demand has expired, Court set a $1,000.00 signature bond.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference on 12/1/15 at 8:30 am, final pretrial conference on 1/25/16 at 8:30 am and jury trial on 2/29/16 at 10:00 am in Branch 6.  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Amended Information received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Acknowledge of Filing of Writ/Petition.vmb

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 02-27-2015 received and filed. (11 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Thomas Harris.

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in court with standby counsel Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for final pretrial conference.
Defense reports that there is no outstanding discovery due from state.  Standby counsel has sent subpoenas on defendant's behalf.  Preliminary hearing transcript has been received.  Discs have been recovered from defendant's property, but did not include revocation hearing transcript.  Defendant would like to keep scheduled trial date and agrees that revocation hearing transcript will not be addressed at trial because state was not furnished with a copy.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on 11/30/15 at 10:00 am in Branch 6.
Original Transcript (11pages) commencing 02-27-2015, PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.
Notice of Petition Denial by Court of Appeals dated November 5, 2015.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in court with standby counsel Thomas Harris, pro se.  Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for final pretrial conference.
Court appoints attorney Thomas Harris as standby counsel.  Court ordered attorney Harris is to be paid by the County of Milwaukee at a rate of $60.00/hour.  Court waives repayment by defendant.  Standby counsel raised issues regarding trial date, however defendant is not willing to reschedule speedy trial as it expires on 11/30/15.  Defendant has received a copy of his revocation hearing transcript on a disc but is not able to listen to it as he is in custody.  Defendant is to bring disc to next court date so that copies can be made for the state and standby counsel.  Defendant addressed outstanding discovery concerns.  Criminal history documents have been provided.  State informed Court that there is no DNA-related communication to be provided.  State will contact defendant this afternoon after hearing from detective regarding copies of memo books that were requested.  Court addressed Court of Appeals denial of defendant's petition.  Court stated the defendant can draft orders for her review regarding this petition.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial conference in Branch 6.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Thomas Harris agreed to appointment as standby counsel for defendant.

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for final pretrial conference.
Discussion regarding witnesses to be questioned at jury trial.  Defendant requests standby counsel be appointed.  Court grants defendant's request.  Attorney Christian Eichenlaub appeared as a friend of the Court and informed Court that the Public Defender's Office does not appoint standby counsel.  Court will appoint standby counsel and they will be advised of next court.  Standby counsel is to help defendant with witness subpoenas.  Defendant states that he has yet to receive some discovery including witness criminal histories and memo book pages.  Court ordered state to furnish the defendant with such discovery.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial conference in Branch 6.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant's Exhibit List received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant's Witness List received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant's Preliminary Motions in Limine and Pretrial Motions received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
per order dated November 5, 2015, Appeal 2015AP2099CRLV, petition to leave appeal is dismissed.
MOTION FOR SUBPEONA, received and filed. lms
from the defendant, received and filed. lms

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

State has a trial pending in another court with a victim flying from another State and request an adjourned trial date.   Defendant is on a VOP hold.   State needs to provide additonal discovery to defense.   Defendant request State resend medical records that he claims to not have received.  Defendant request a speedy trial demand.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 6.  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Final Pretrial scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
MOTION TO RECONSIDER, received and filed. lms

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in court.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Case remains set for jury trial.  State to call 5 witnesses, defense none.  Trial is anticipated to last 3 days.  No Miranda motion filed.  State to not enter Wrongful Acts or character evidence.  State to have an expert witness.  Defendant files a Motion to Reconsider.  Parties address defense Motion in Limine in court.  All discovery has been provided to defense.  Court addressed defendant's Motion to Consider and DENIES the Motion.  Court addressed State's motion in limine.  Today is the last day court will accept plea negotiations.  Case is adjourned for jury trial in branch 6 on 8/10/2015.   State has made the court aware of possible issues with going to trial on this case.

Defendant reminded that there is a no contact order in effect.  Defendant to have no contact with the victim.  If contact occurs, the court will consider modifying bail.

Defendant's motion to dismiss argued and denied by the court.  Court finds motion to be frivilous. Defendant's motion to compel mental health records argued and denied by the court.  Defendant's motion to compel recorded statements granted by the court.  State informs court there is no forensic interview.  Defendant's motion to subpoena documents addressed by the court.  Copy of orignal signed scheduling order given to defendant.  Case remains calendared on 7-27-2015  at 8:30 a.m. for final pretrial in Branch 10.

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's motion that counsel withdraw and he be allowed to proceeded pro se argued.  Defendant's examined as to his right to counsel.  Defendant's motion to proceed pro se granted by the court.  Filed, signed Waiver of Right to Attorney.

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 10.
Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in custody produced.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.    Counsel informed Court there has been a breakdown in communication.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Court advised defendant this will be the last public defender appointed.  Defendant was informed by the Court that he will not be produced for the next hearing.   Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 10.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Withdraw received and filed. tk

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman not in court, in custody.  Cindy L. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Scheduling conference held off the record.  Defense counsel would like motion to withdraw.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion to withdraw hearing in Branch 10.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Steve Wells-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SLH (12/31/00) or Jennifer J.

Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Shannon Darrell Coleman in custody.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
